name: Curcumin/Tumeric
notes: Halal if pure grind turmeric powder or granular. Mushbooh if used as liquid, the solvents has to be Halal. Haraam if hidden ingredient is pork fat based emulsifier in dry mix.

name: Riboflavin (Vitamin B2)
notes: Mushbooh (Haraam if from pork liver & Kidney, Halal if 100% plant material

name: Tartrazine
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Quinoline Yellow
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent other than water has to be Halal

name: Sunset Yellow FCF / Orange Yellow S
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Cochineal / Carminic Acid
notes: Source: From insect Cochineal

name: Carmoisine / Azorubine
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Amaranth
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Ponceau 4R / Cochineal Red A
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Erythrosine BS
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Patent Blue V
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Indigo Carmine / Idigotine
notes: Halal if use as is as a 100% synthetic color  but if pork glycerin is added as a solvent then it is Haraam

name: Chlorophyll
notes: Halal if use 100% powder or Halal if water or vegetable oil was used as a solvent

name: Copper Complex of Chlorophyll
notes: Halal if use 100% powder or Halal if water or vegetable oil was used as a solvent

name: Green S / Acid Brilliant Green BS
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Black PN / Brilliant Black BN
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Carbon Black / Vegetable Carbon (Charcoal)
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Alpha, Beta, Gamma
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Capsanthin / Capsorbin
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Lycopene
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Beta-apo-8-carotenal
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry powder or granular or Halal if vegetable oil is used as a solvent in liquid form as a hidden ingredient. Haraam if pork gelatin is used as hidden ingredient or carrier

name: Ethyl ester of Beta-apo-8-cartonoic acid
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry powder or granular or Halal if vegetable oil is used as a solvent in liquid form as a hidden ingredient. Haraam if pork gelatin is used as hidden ingredient or carrier

name: Flavoxanthin
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Lutein
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry powder or granular. Haraam if pork gelatin or pork glycerin is added in dry or liquid form

name: Cryptoxanthin
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Rubixanthin
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Violaxanthin
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Rhodoxanthin
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Canthaxanthin
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Beetroot Red / Betanin
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal

name: Anthocyanins
notes: Halal if used as 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal
